meanings.definition: The state of being unable to move or be moved.
meanings.sent1: After the accident, his immobility was evident as he lay still on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended physical therapy to prevent muscle stiffness caused by immobility.
meanings.sent3: The cat's sudden immobility in front of the mouse was a failed attempt at stealth.
meanings.sent4: The immobility of the old clock symbolized the passage of time in the abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: The immobility of the boulder made it impossible to move without help.

meanings.sent1: The immobility of the lake's surface indicated a calm day for fishing.
meanings.sent2: The bear's immobility in the forest alerted the hikers to its presence.
meanings.sent3: The immobility of the sloth amused the zoo visitors as it barely moved a muscle.
meanings.sent4: The immobility of the city streets on Sunday mornings was a stark contrast to the weekday hustle.
meanings.sent5: The immobility of the caterpillar fascinated the children as they observed its slow progress.
